newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: S.Korean prosecutors summon more bankers over Hanbo.
newsitem.headline: S.Korean prosecutors summon more bankers over Hanbo.

text.p: South Korea's state prosecutors on Thursday summoned two more leading bankers over a loan scandal surrounding insolvent Hanbo Steel Co, a prosecution official said.
They are Chang Myung-son, president of the Korea Exchange Bank, and Kim Shi-hyung, head of the state-run Korea Development Bank.
"The two bankers were summoned to the prosecution office this morning," the official said. "They are now being questioned."
On Wednesday, the prosecutors arrested the heads of two other leading banks -- Sheen Kwang-shik of Korea First Bank and Woo Chan-mok of Cho Hung Bank -- on charges of bribery.

The four banks are the main creditors of Hanbo Steel, South Korea's second largest steelmaker, which was declared insolvent on January 23 after accumulating about five trillion won ($5.8 billion) in loans.
Lee Chong-yeon, a former Cho Hung Bank president, was also being questioned by the prosecutors, the official said.
